rooms.description: A welcoming entrance hall with ample natural light and adheres to Vastu principles by aligning the main door in the east direction.
An open-plan living area that flows into the kitchen. The design maximizes space and light exposure while incorporating colonial aesthetics with exposed wooden beams and high ceilings.
Adjacent to the living area, this dining room maintains a balanced flow in accordance with Vastu principles. It provides space for family gatherings and dining events.
The open-plan kitchen seamlessly integrates with the living area, ensuring easy movement between spaces while including essential modern appliances in a colonial style setting.
A dedicated entertainment zone designed as an extension of the living room, featuring soundproofing elements and comfortable seating, ensuring minimal external noise interference.
Connected to both the living area and kitchen, this bathroom is designed with colonial fixtures and ensures proper drainage and ventilation as per local building norms.
A storage space for household items and appliances, ensuring efficient use of space in the ground floor layout.

openings.description: The main entrance door is positioned on the east wall to align with Vastu guidelines promoting prosperity and positive energy.
Multiple windows are evenly distributed along the north and south walls to ensure balanced light and ventilation while adhering to colonial aesthetics.
A balcony provides a transitional space between the interior living area and an outdoor terrace or garden area, respecting Vastu principles by allowing natural light flow.

rooms.description: A master bedroom featuring a private balcony and en-suite bathroom. Designed with colonial elements such as ornate crown moldings and high-quality wood finishes.
The second bedroom provides ample space for a guest or family member. Colonial detailing includes built-in wardrobes and elegant window frames.
The third bedroom is designed to be versatile, potentially serving as a study or guest room with colonial finishes.
A compact yet comfortable bedroom suitable for children or additional guests. Maintains colonial aesthetics in trim and detailing.
A versatile room that can be adapted into an office or home library, incorporating colonial design elements with built-in shelving.
The final bedroom is designed to serve multiple purposes and can be adapted based on changing family needs. Colonial accents are evident in the trim details.
A functional bathroom serving as a secondary utility space for the upper floor.

openings.description: A well-designed staircase connects the ground and first floors while ensuring safety and aesthetics in line with colonial style.
Balconies integrated into several bedroom layouts provide fresh air and light while aligning with Vastu principles.
